problems.title: Determine Type of Number
problems.description:
Given a number, determine its type and print:
- "Perfect Square" if it's a perfect square (e.g., 4, 9, 16)
- "Even" if it's even and not a perfect square
- "Odd" if it's odd and not a perfect square

Note: Perfect squares can be even or odd. If a number is a perfect square, print "Perfect Square" regardless of parity.

Input Format:
Single positive integer.

Output Format:
Print "Perfect Square", "Even", or "Odd".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
16

Sample Output
Perfect Square

Sample Input
10

Sample Output
Even

Sample Input
15

Sample Output
Odd

Sample Input
25

Sample Output
Perfect Square

Explanation:
First check if number is a perfect square (by checking if square root is an integer), then check even/odd.
hintsList: Check if number is a perfect square first (sqrt is integer). If yes, print "Perfect Square". Else check if even or odd.
